weather.summary: Saturday: 8°C, light rain. Sunday: 9°C, light rain

metadata.greeting: Hey George! Get ready for a weekend of indoor adventures! We've got some super cool ideas, like riding the DLR, meeting farm animals, and diving into storytelling magic. Let's explore!

activities.title: Discover a world of stories
activities.description: Immerse yourself in interactive storytelling exhibits, dress up as your favourite characters, and meet special guests. It's a world of imagination brought to life!
activities.whyGeorgeWillLove: With dressing up and character visits, it's like stepping into a real-life episode of Hey Duggee or Peppa Pig!

transport.tip: Look for character meet-and-greets!

activities.title: DLR Adventure to Mudchute Farm
activities.description: Take a thrilling DLR ride (sit at the front!) to Mudchute, the biggest city farm in Europe. See llamas, sheep, cows and other farm animals.
activities.whyGeorgeWillLove: He'll love the train ride to see farm animals!

transport.fromHackney: Overground to Shadwell, then DLR to Mudchute, 30 mins
transport.tip: Sit at the front of the DLR for the best views!

activities.title: Farm Fun at Hackney City Farm
activities.description: Meet pigs, goats, donkeys, and chickens at this charming city farm. Enjoy a coffee at the cafe or try your hand at pottery.
activities.whyGeorgeWillLove: He can see real farm animals up close!

transport.fromHackney: 394/26 bus or Overground to Hoxton, 10 mins
transport.tip: Check out the farm's pottery classes.

activities.title: Design and Play at the Young V&A
activities.description: Explore the under 5s play area and participate in design workshops at this museum dedicated to creativity. Perfect for sparking imagination!
activities.whyGeorgeWillLove: With hands-on exhibits, George can explore and create!

transport.fromHackney: Bus 26 or Overground to Bethnal Green, 15 mins
transport.tip: Check out the daily activities schedule.

activities.title: Explore the V&A East Storehouse
activities.description: Discover a world of visible storage displays at this brand new museum. It's a fascinating peek behind the scenes of the V&A's collections.
activities.whyGeorgeWillLove: He might enjoy seeing the tools and designs!

transport.tip: Combine with a visit to the Olympic Park.

activities.title: Home Sweet Home at the Museum of the Home
activities.description: Explore different rooms through time and see how people used to live. They also have gardens to explore.
activities.whyGeorgeWillLove: The hands-on rooms are great for touching and feeling!

transport.tip: Check out the temporary exhibitions for kids.

activities.title: Trampoline Fun at Flip Out
activities.description: Jump, flip, and bounce to your heart's content at Flip Out! They have a dedicated soft play area for under 5s, best enjoyed in the mornings.
activities.whyGeorgeWillLove: He can burn off energy and practice his climbing skills!

transport.tip: Book online in advance.

activities.title: Dinosaur Adventure at the Natural History Museum
activities.description: Roar with excitement in the Dinosaur gallery, marvel at the Blue Whale, and explore the fascinating Wildlife Garden. Don't miss the T-Rex!
activities.whyGeorgeWillLove: DINOSAURS!! And a T-Rex!

transport.fromHackney: Overground to Highbury & Islington, then Victoria line to South Kensington, 40 mins
transport.tip: Go early to avoid crowds.

activities.title: Train and Bus Adventures at the London Transport Museum
activities.description: Climb aboard vintage buses and trains, explore the tube simulator, and play in the All Aboard zone. Don't forget the stamper trail!
activities.whyGeorgeWillLove: He can climb on real buses and trains!

transport.fromHackney: Overground to Highbury & Islington, then Victoria line to Green Park, then Jubilee line to Charing Cross, 45 mins
transport.tip: Under 18s are free!

activities.title: Flight and Fun at the RAF Museum
activities.description: Explore huge aircraft hangers filled with planes and helicopters. Enjoy the outdoor playground and catch a 4D cinema show.
activities.whyGeorgeWillLove: He can see real planes and helicopters up close!

transport.fromHackney: Overground to Gospel Oak, then Overground to Willesden Junction, then Jubilee Line to Colindale, 50 mins
transport.tip: Check out the free family activities.

activities.title: Science Fun at the Science Museum
activities.description: Explore The Garden (under 5s area), the Flight gallery, and Making the Modern World (TRAINS!). Consider a Wonderlab visit (paid).
activities.whyGeorgeWillLove: TRAINS! Plus lots of hands-on exhibits to explore.

transport.fromHackney: Overground to Highbury & Islington, then Victoria line to South Kensington, 40 mins
transport.tip: Book Wonderlab tickets in advance.

activities.title: Ahoy! at the National Maritime Museum
activities.description: Explore ships, play in the AHOY! children's gallery (under 7s), and enjoy the playground outside. Great views of the Thames!
activities.whyGeorgeWillLove: He can explore ships and imagine being a sailor!

transport.fromHackney: Overground to Stratford, then Jubilee line to North Greenwich, then Jubilee line to Canary Wharf, then DLR to Cutty Sark, 50 mins
transport.tip: Take a Thames Clipper boat from Tower Pier for a fun trip!

activities.title: Walruses and Wonder at the Horniman Museum
activities.description: See the famous overstuffed walrus, explore the instruments gallery, and enjoy the gardens with animals. The aquarium is a paid extra.
activities.whyGeorgeWillLove: He can see real animals and weird things!

transport.fromHackney: Overground to Highbury & Islington, then Overground to Forest Hill, 50 mins
transport.tip: Check out the musical instrument collection.

bookAhead.title: Book Ahead
bookAhead.subtitle: Coming up in the next 2-8 weeks

activities.title: Hey Duggee Live
activities.description: Join Duggee and the Squirrels for a fun-filled live show with singing, dancing, and badge-earning activities. A guaranteed hit with Hey Duggee fans!
activities.whyGeorgeWillLove: It's Hey Duggee! He can earn badges just like the Squirrels.

transport.tip: Book tickets early as they sell out quickly.

activities.title: Dinosaur World Live
activities.description: Meet life-size dinosaur puppets in this thrilling and educational show. Get up close with a T-Rex and other amazing creatures!
activities.whyGeorgeWillLove: LIFE-SIZE DINOSAURS!

transport.tip: Some dinosaurs can be a little scary, so be prepared.

activities.title: Bluey's Big Play
activities.description: See Bluey, Bingo, Mum and Dad as they've never been seen before, in this brand-new theatrical adaptation of the Emmy® award-winning television series.
activities.whyGeorgeWillLove: It's Bluey, just like on TV!

transport.tip: Bring Bluey toys to wave!

activities.title: Peppa Pig Live
activities.description: Join Peppa, George, Mummy Pig, and Daddy Pig for a musical adventure filled with singing, dancing, and muddy puddles!
activities.whyGeorgeWillLove: He can see Peppa Pig and her family on stage!

transport.tip: Wear your wellies in case of muddy puddles!

activities.title: The Gruffalo
activities.description: Join Mouse on a daring adventure through the deep dark wood to outsmart the Gruffalo in this magical stage adaptation of the beloved book.
activities.whyGeorgeWillLove: It's the Gruffalo!

transport.tip: Read the book beforehand to prepare.

activities.title: Room on the Broom
activities.description: Join the witch and her animal friends on a whirlwind adventure in this enchanting stage adaptation of Julia Donaldson's Room on the Broom.
activities.whyGeorgeWillLove: He loves animals and witches!

transport.tip: A great show for little ones.

activities.title: Half Moon Theatre Shows
activities.description: Check out the Half Moon Theatre for a range of regular kids shows!
activities.whyGeorgeWillLove: It's close to Hackney and has shows for little ones.

transport.tip: Check the website for specific shows suitable for 3 year olds.
